## trustCertsOnRemote() function

Trust the certificate for a given hostname and port and add the returned cert to the local trust store.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function trustCertsOnRemote(hostname: string, port: number, certPath: string, renewalBufferInBusinessDays: number, getRemoteCertsFunc?: typeof getRemoteCertificate, closeRemoteFunc?: typeof closeRemoteServer): Promise<{
    mustRenew: boolean;
}>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  hostname | <code>string</code> | hostname of the remote machine |
|  port | <code>number</code> | port to connect the remote machine |
|  certPath | <code>string</code> | file path to store the cert |
|  renewalBufferInBusinessDays | <code>number</code> |  |
|  getRemoteCertsFunc | <code>typeof getRemoteCertificate</code> |  |
|  closeRemoteFunc | <code>typeof closeRemoteServer</code> |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

`Promise<{
    mustRenew: boolean;
}>`
